Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Membro del comitato editoriale della rivista "Shaman"

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Relatore alla Conferenza "Halfdan Siiger and Danish Central Asian Research” University, University of Copenhagen, National Museum (Copenhagen). Organizers: Aarhus University, University of Copenhagen, the National Museum of Denmark, and Moesgård Museum.
Relatore Seminario " Le Religioni dei Lepcha", Dipartimento Storia Culture Religioni, Universita´ di Roma “La Sapienza”.

Relatore (con Diana Riboli) American Anthropological Association (AAA) annual meeting, San Francisco. Invited session (sponsored by Society for the Anthropology of Religion) on 17 nov. 2012 : Shamanic Communities Defending and bridging Borders. Paper presentato: "Of Aggressive Spirits, Maoists and Other Gods. Shamans, Conflicts and Violence In Nepal".

Membro del Comitato Organizzativo della undicesima Conferenza ISSR (International Society for Shamanic Research) "Traditional Rituals and Spiritual Harmony in the Changing Globalized World" Guizhou Institute for Advanced Study in Anthropology & Ethnology (GIASAE), Guizhou Normal College (Guiyang, Guizhou Province, China). Organizzatore del Panel: "Shamanism and Violence". Relatore del paper: "A Retrospective view on Violence".

Membro del comitato organizzativo della conferenza internazionale "Putative Purities - Transcultural Dimensions of Master Narratives in Religion", Universita´ di Heidelberg. Relatore del paper: "From geographical periphery to conceptual centre: the travels of sNgagchang Shakya Zangpo and the discovery of Yolmo identity".
Relatore del paper “From Helambu Sherpa to Nepalese Hyolmo” alla ventitreesima ECSAS (European Conference on South Asian Studies) , Universita´ di Zurigo.

Relatore alla sesta conferenza annuale internazionale ADI (Asian Dynamics Initiative) "Intra-Asian Connections: Interactions, flows, landscapes", Universita´ di Copenhagen. Moderatore di una sessione del Panel "Travel along the Silk Road". Relatore del paper: "Travels, Historicities and Identity: the trans-himalayan voyage of Ngagchang Shakya Zangpo and its importance for the contemporary Nepalese Hyolmo community".

Organizzatore del Workshop internazionale "The Hyolmo of Nepal" presso il Cluster of Excellence Asia and Europe in a Global Context, Karl Jaspers Centre for Advanced Transcultural Studies, Universita´ di Heidelberg. Moderatore di una sessione. Relatore del paper: "To Kill or not to Kill? The issue of Blood Sacrifice and the Transformation of Ritual Patterns in Hyolmo Shamanism".

Organizzatore del workshop internazionale "Uneven Margins - Transcultural Dynamics and Religious Violence in South Asia and the Himalayan Regions", Cluster of Excellence, HCTS, Karl Jaspers Centre for Advanced Transcultural Studies, Universita´ di Heidelberg. Moderatore di una sessione. Paper presentato: "Helambu valley as a 'no kill' zone. Animal sacrifice, shamanism and Buddhism among the Hyolmo of Nepal".

Membro del comitato organizzativo per la conferenza internazionale "Transcultural Encounters in the Himalayan Borderlands: Kalimpong as a 'Contact Zone'", organizzata dal Cluster of Excellence Asia Europe, Universita´di Heidelberg, a Kalimpong (India). Moderatore della sessione numero 2.
Relatore del seminario "On Himalayan Shamanism", Anthropology Department, Sikkim State University, Gangtok (India).
Relatore del paper "The Buddha and the Drum. Landscape, Ritual and Identity among the Hyolmo of Nepal", presso il Centre d'Etudes Himalayennes, CNRS, Villejuif, (France).
Relatore del paper Lecture “On Shamanism. A brief Introduction”, South Asia Institute (University of Heidelberg), Kathmandu Office lecture series 2015 (Nepal).

Membro del comitato organizzativo della conferenza ISARS (International Society for the Academic Research on Shamanism) “Sacred Landscapes and Conflict Transformation. History, Space, Place and Power in Shamanism”, European Cultural Centre of Delphi (ECCD), (Grecia). Moderatore di una sessione. Relatore del paper: “Losing Ground, Moving Forward. Hyolmo shamanism and the negotiation over space, landscape and ritual”. Paper presented: “Losing Ground, Moving Forward. Hyolmo shamanism and the negotiation over space, landscape and ritual”

Membro del comitato organizzativo della conferenza "Religious Revivals and Artistic Renaissance in Central Asia and the Himalayan Region — Past and Present" Fourth International SEECHAC Colloquium European Society for Studies of Central Asia and Himalayan Regions. Moderatore di una sessione. Relatore del paper: "The Importance of Being a Beyul: Landscape, Buddhism, Shamanism and Identity among the Nepal’s Hyolmo".
Relatore al workshop "Spirited Dharma: Exploring Possession in Asian Buddhist Traditions", SOAS, London. Paper: "Buddhism and Shamanism among the Hyolmo of Nepal".

Relatore al workshop "Religious Authority beyond the Nation", School of Arts, Languages and Cultures, Universita´ di Manchester, Manchester (Regno Unito). Paper: "From periphery to centre: Hyolmo society between local and translocal influences".

Relatore alla Tavola Rotonda "Heritage in Times of Crisis: Transcultural Approaches to Reconstruction and Revaluation in Post-Earthquake Nepal" nel corso della conferenza annuale del Cluster of Excellence Asia and Europe “Making, Sustaining, Breaking – The Politics Of Heritage And Culture” in collaborazione con il Forum Transregionale Studien (Berlin), il Max Weber Stiftung – Deutsche Geisteswissenschaftliche Institute im Ausland ed il German Archaeological Institute (Berlin), tenuta presso il Karl Jaspers Centre, Universita´ di Heidelberg. Panel: Heritage in Times of Crisis: Transcultural Approaches to Reconstruction and Revaluation in Post-Earthquake Nepal – Roundtable.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Lecturer presso il Dipartimento di Teologia e Studi Religioni della Universita´ di Chester (Regno Unito) per i corsi di "Antropologia delle Religioni", "Introduzione allo Hinduismo", "Introduzione al Buddhismo", "Religioni dei Popoli Indigeni", piu´ seminari e guest-lectures in altri corsi ("MInoranze religiose dell´Unione Europea"; "Ritual Studies", etc.)

Lecturer presso il Cluster of Excellence Asia and Europe in a Global Context per vari corsi (Hauptseminar) per il programma di Master in Studi Transculturali (in allegato schermata pagina web relativa all´A.A. in corso)

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Ricercatore all´interno del progetto MC3.3 ("Negotiating Boundaries in Religious Discourse and Practice. Buddhism between South Asia and Tibet – Negotiating Religious Boundaries in Doctrine and Practice") del Cluster of Excellence Asia and Europe, Univ. di Heidelberg.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Membro Associato del Cluster of Excellence Asia and Europe in a Global Context ( Univ. di Heidelberg)

research fellowship per l´anno accademico 2017-2018 presso il Centrum für Religionswissenschaftliche Studien, Käte Hamburger Kolleg (KHK), Bochum, programma di ricerca “Dynamics in the History of Religions between Asia and Europe”
